raw_text: Modifications of this model are reported in Turner and Charniak (2005) and Galley and McKeown (2007) with improved results
clean_text: Modifications of this model are reported in Turner and Charniak (2005) and Galley and McKeown (2007) with improved results.

raw_text: (Galley and McKeown, 2007) extended the noisy-channel approach and proposed a head-drivenMarkovization formulation of synchronous context free grammar (SCFG) deletion rules
clean_text: (Galley and McKeown, 2007) extended the noisy-channel approach and proposed a head-driven Markovization formulation of synchronous context free grammar (SCFG) deletion rules.

raw_text: 2.2.4 Compression Using Lexicalized Markov Grammars The last sentence compression method we use is the lexicalized Markov grammar-based approach (Galleyand McKeown, 2007) with edit word detection (Charniak and Johnson, 2001)
clean_text: The last sentence compression method we use is the lexicalized Markov grammar-based approach (Galley and McKeown, 2007) with edit word detection (Charniak and Johnson, 2001).

citing_paper_authors: Courtney, Napoles | Chris, Callison-Burch | Juri, Ganitkevitch | Benjamin, van Durme
raw_text: Most of the previous research on sentence compression focuses on deletion using syntactic information, (e.g., Galley and McKeown (2007), Knightand Marcu (2002), Nomoto (2009), Galanis and Androutsopoulos (2010), Filippova and Strube (2008), McDonald (2006), Yamangil and Shieber (2010), Cohn and Lapata (2008), Cohn and Lapata (2009), Turner and Charniak (2005))
Where the tree pairs are isomorphic, synchronous context-free grammars (SCFG) may suffice, but in general, non-isomorphism can make the problem of rule extraction difficult (Galley and McKeown,2007)
clean_text: Where the tree pairs are isomorphic, synchronous context-free grammars (SCFG) may suffice, but in general, non-isomorphism can make the problem of rule extraction difficult (Galley and McKeown,2007).

raw_text: Galley and McKeown (2007) show improvements to the noisy-channel approach based on rule lexicaliza tion and rule Markovization
clean_text: Galley and McKeown (2007) show improvements to the noisy-channel approach based on rule lexicalization and rule Markovization.

raw_text: We use the sentence pairs available in the Ziff-Davis Tree Alignmentcorpus (Galley and McKeown, 2007)
clean_text: We use the sentence pairs available in the Ziff-Davis Tree Alignment corpus (Galley and McKeown, 2007).

citing_paper_authors: Lu, Wang | Hema, Raghavan | Vittorio, Castelli | Radu, Florian | Claire, Cardie
raw_text: Rather than attempt to derive a new parse tree like Knight and Marcu (2000) and Galley and McKeown (2007), we learn to safely re move a set of constituents in our parse tree-based compression model while preserving grammatical structure and essential content
clean_text: Rather than attempt to derive a new parse tree like Knight and Marcu (2000) and Galley and McKeown (2007), we learn to safely remove a set of constituents in our parse tree-based compression model while preserving grammatical structure and essential content.
